oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1941-02-08 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 8, 1941. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff, Ford Rush, Oscar Stone and his Possum Hunters, Bashful Brother Oswald (mentioned but not present on this part), and Pap & Odie (likely Lonnie Wilson and Curly Rhodes respectively) (mentioned but not present on this part). Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Jamup & Honey; Oscar Stone; Possum Hunters; Ford Rush
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Letter Edged In Black (Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay talks -- Letter Edged In Black (reprise) (Roy Acuff) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- George D. Hay introduces Jamup & Honey -- Comedy routine (Jamup & Honey) -- George D. Hay introduces Oscar Stone and his Possum Hunters -- Greenwood (Oscar Stone and his Possum Hunters) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- You Are My Sunshine (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Little Liza Jane (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Acuff, Roy; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Bashful Brother Oswald; Pap & Odie; Wilson, Lonnie; Rhodes, Curly; Jamup & Honey; Stone, Oscar, 1881-; Possum Hunters (Musical group)
